learning_outcomes.description: to critically engage with scholarly and industry texts relating to instrumental music learning and theories of learning and motivation
to guide students in the development of instrumental performance of your instrument in a practical setting

to articulate critical reflections on your own teaching practice with reference to contemporary research in music pedagogy as well as learning and motivation theories in both written and spoken contexts

assessments.assessment_title: Analysis of scholarly and industry texts (1500 words)
assessments.task_description:
Analysis of scholarly and industry texts (1500 words)

Due Week 5

Submit an comparative critique of 9 texts influencing your approach to one-one instrumental studio teaching practice. 

Texts may include:

  • transcripts of interviews with notable performers or pedagogues of your instrument (these must be publicly available)
  • scholarly articles or book chapters related to the performance of your instrument
  • articles from non-scholarly, professional publications (e.g., The Strad magazine, for string players) 


Draw out themes you consider most relevant to your practice of instrumental teaching and learning. For example, you may wish to focus on matters of instrumental technique, musical audiation, practice, performance and motivation, amongst other factors. Explain how these themes are important in your conceptual framework, and highlight where agreements or arguments exist among texts.

 

A separate reference section should be included for all texts. This is NOT included in the word count.

+-10% word count will be allowed. 

A cover sheet must be included. 

Please use the School of Music style sheet for academic style. music academic writing guide (PDF, 1.5 MB)
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Teaching Practice Video and Oral Presentation (video) and Peer feedback
assessments.due_date:
Teaching video 1 and reflection 11/08/2025 5:00 pm

Teaching video 2 and reflection 25/08/2025 5:00 pm

Teaching video 3 and reflection 8/09/2025 5:00 pm

Teaching video 4 and reflection 22/09/2025 5:00 pm

Video: Oral report 7/10/2025 5:00 pm

Peer feedback 13/10/2025 5:00 pm

All components of this assessment must be completed to pass.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment is in three parts, all of which must be completed to pass the assessment. :

 

PART 1 (0% hurdle requirement): Video submission of four 30min teaching episodes with 250 word reflection


You will submit four (4) x 30 minute video recordings of lessons with a current student. Each video should be accompanied by a 250-word reflection explaining how the lesson reflects learning from the lectures preceding submission and how the lessons prepare following lessons and reflect on prior lessons.

  • Video 1 and reflection should be uploaded to the discussion board by Monday of week 3. 
  • Video 2 and reflection should be uploaded to the discussion board by Monday of week 5. 
  • Video 3 and reflection should be uploaded to the discussion board by Monday of week 7. 
  • Video 4 and reflection should be uploaded to the discussion board by Monday of week 9. 

 

If it is not possible to teach a current student for this task, you may enlist a friend or family member to be your teaching subject. 

Permission must be sought prior to recording lessons and submitted to the course coordinator with an official Consent Form.

If the student is under 18, this must be filled in by a legal guardian. 

IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO PASS PART 1 WITHOUT SUBMITTING A SIGNED CONSENT FORM.

 

PART 2 - Due Tuesday 7th October 17:00 (30%)

Video presentation: Oral Report on teaching practice videos


You will upload a Video Report of your experiences in the Teaching Practice Assessment to the Course Blackboard Site 'Discussion Board'. 

The oral report should include:

  1. lesson themes
  2. how your experiences interact with the learning content of this course
  3. successes and failures of the lessons and possible reasons
  4. how you would continue with future lessons of this student

 

The time limit is strict: marks will be deducted for going over or under the time limit. The use of speed alteration in the video is not permitted, a normal talking speed is required.

You are advised to script and rehearse your submission before making the video. Videos must be filmed in English, with a clear view of the speaker. 

PART 3 - Due Monday 13th October, 17:00 Peer Feedback (Hurdle requirement)

You will provide 3x written feedback (250-word) to class members who submitted immediately after you on the Course Blackboard Site 'Discussion Board'.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Links to videos must be submitted via BlackBoard: Discussion Board: Teaching Video Links
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Viva Voce 40%

You will have an in-person conversation with course staff to discuss your learning in the course and your approaches to instrumental teaching. To pass this assessment, you will need to demonstrate an understanding of the themes of the course presented throughout the semester and how these interact with your own experiences in teaching and learning instrumental music.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
